msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Removed the [ExcludeClass] metadata on the out-of-package class FTETextFieldStyleResolver in TLFTextField.as. It was actually causing TLFTextField to be excluded, and is not necessary on an out-of-package class, which is invisible except to code in the same file.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Addressed most of the FIXMEs in TLFTextField. The main changes are:

It now starts listening for the 'render' event only when it becomes invalid, and stops listening when it has been validated. Previously, it listened for the 'render' event whenever it was onstage. This change should improve performance.
It now uses a static TextField to initialize the defaultTextFormat rather than creating a TextFormat object and filling it out.
The logic to avoid getting or setting the scrollRect property unless it non-null is now in overrides of scrollRect.
The value of condenseWhite used to process the htmlText is now the value when htmlText is set. Previously, it was the value at render time, which could be different.
The validateNow() method now does no work if neither the TextLines nor the Graphics are invalid.
A background (at alpha = 0 if background == false) is always drawn now, to provide the correct mouse bounds.
It now invalidates in response to INLINE_GRAPHIC_STATUS_CHANGE events from the TextFlow, to handle asynchronous s.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Add support for styleSheet used with htmlText.  Convert from the TextField's css style sheet to the equivalent TLF formats.
The CSS body class selector is mapped to the TLF TextFlow, the CSS p class selector is mapped to the TLF Paragraph element and the CSS span selector is mapped to the TLF span element.
CSS class selectors are mapped to the TLF style attribute.  For example:
is mapped to the TLF paragraph element style name.
<span class="styleName"> is mapped to the TLF span element style name.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Prepping to update textLayout sources with a more recent build.  TLFTextField is no longer in textLayout since we now own it.  It is being moved to spark.swc and will live with UITLFTextField in mx.core.
Reviewer: Gordon asked me to do this
Tests run: checkintests and a few of my own that use TLFTextField
